intro: Olmedia habas, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. The flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
